lines.text: It's Christmas Eve! It's... it's the one night of the year when we all act a little nicer, we... we... we smile a little easier, we... w-w-we... we... we cheer a little more. For a couple of hours out of the whole year, we are the people that we always hoped we would be!
Mom, when are we gonna get a real Christmas tree?
When they're free!
Taxi! Can you get me to the IBC building in three minutes?
Which floor?
I was a captain of industry; feared by men, adored by women.
Adored! Come on, let's be honest, Lew. You *paid* for the women!
[Props man tries to attach antlers to a mouse]
I can't get the antlers glued to this little guy. We tried Crazy Glue, but it don't work.
Did you try staples?
The bitch hit me with a toaster!
Do you think I'm way off base here?
Yes. You're, well, you're a tad off base, sir. That thing looked like The Manson Family Christmas Special!
[after pouring a bucket of water on a waiter he thought was on fire]
I'm sorry. You know I thought you were Richard Pryor!
Close your eyes...! And think of snowflakes and moonbeams and whiskers on kittens...
[She notices Frank peeking and goes to jab his eys with two fingers]
Nooooo peeking!
[Frank blocks the jab and closes his eyes]
Of rainbows, forget-me-nots... of misty meadows and sun-dappled pools. Oh, look! There's Mr Hedgehog. I wonder where he's going? Perhaps to HARLEM!
[She punches Frank]
My jaw!
Sometimes the truth is painful, Frank.
[She slaps his face]
But it's made your cheeks rosy and your eyes bright!
If you TOUCH ME AGAlN, I'll rip your goddamned wings off! Okay?
I never liked a girl well enough to give her twelve sharp knives.
Boy, that Dick sure knows how to drink, huh?
Why do you keep calling me "Dick"?
I'm sorry, Mr. Burton, I guess we don't know you well enough yet to call you Dick.
I get it. You're taking me back in time to show me my mother and father, and I'm supposed to get all goosey and blubbery. Well, forget it, pal, you got the wrong guy!
That's exactly what Attila the Hun said. But when he saw his mother... Niagara Falls!
Hello, IBC program room.
This is Rhinelander. Who's the idiot that put that nut on the air?
Oh, uh, Brice Cummings is the idiot, sir, but uh... he can't talk to you right now because he's sorta tied up. Uh-huh. Oh, in fact, he just said that you were a flatulating butthead?
A butthead?
He said he never felt that way about a man before, but you really looked good in a suit.
I'm alive! Yes! I'm *alive*!

[aims a shotgun at Frank]
Not for long!
Same old Claire... still trying to save the world.
You still trying to run it?
it's never too late. You can always change tomorrow if you want to.

There are people who are having trouble making their miracle happen; there are people who don't have enough to eat, there are people who are cold, you can go out and say hello to these people. You can take an old blanket out of the closet and go to them and say 'Here!', you can make them a sandwich and say 'oh by the way, here!'

I get it now! Then if you GIVE, then it can happen, then the miracle can happen to you! It's not just the poor and the hungry, it's everybody's who's GOT to have this miracle! And it can happen tonight for all of you. If you believe in this spirit thing, the miracle will happen and then you'll want it to happen again tomorrow. You won't be one of these bastards who says 'Christmas is once a year and it's a fraud', it's NOT! It can happen every day, you've just got to want that feeling. And if you like it and you want it, you'll get greedy for it! You'll want it every day of your life and it can happen to you. I believe in it now! I believe it's going to happen to me now! I'm ready for it! And it's great! It's a good feeling, it's really better than I've felt in a long time. I, I, I'm ready. Have a Merry Christmas, everybody.
[Calvin steps forward]
Did I forget something big man?

[nods, speaks his first words in five years]
God bless us, everyone!

[about Calvin]
He's a bright little guy. What's wrong with him?
He hasn't spoken since he saw his father killed five years ago. He just drifted away, like Sleeping Beauty.
I didn't know Grace's husband died.
Oh Frank, don't you remember the time she wore black for a year?
I remember her wearing black... I thought it was a fashion thing. Everybody was wearing black!
Oh Frank.
Well, is he going to be okay?
It's his choice, only he can break the spell.
It's Lee Majors! The Six Million Dollar Man!
Santa, is there a back way outta this place?
Of course there is Lee, but this is one Santa who's going out the front door.
Look, it don't matter a hill of beans what happens to me but the world couldn't afford it if anything happened to you. Now stay put.
Oh that's very nice of you, Lee. And Lee... You've been a real good boy this year!
Yes you sure have!
[last lines]
My brother, the king of Christmas!
I want to see her nipples.
But this is a CHRISTMAS show.
Well, I'm sure Charles Dickens would have wanted to see her nipples.
You can barely see them nipples.
See? And these guys are REALLY looking.
Let's face it, Frank. Garden slugs got more out of life than you.
Yeah? Name one!
You know what they say about people who treat other people bad on the way up?
Yeah, you get to treat 'em bad on the way back down too. It's great, you get two chances to rough 'em up.
Sometimes you have to *slap* them in the face just to get their attention!

All day long, I listen to people give me excuses why they can't work... 'My back hurts,' 'my legs ache,' 'I'm only four!' The sooner he learns life isn't handed to him on a silver platter, the better!

[repeating the question]
On the "Addams Family", what instrument did Lurch play?
I may be invisible, but I am *not deaf!*
Hey. Are you glad to see me, or is this a shotgun in your pocket?
[toss gun away; it fires]
All right, you've heard it. How's this for a deal? I hire you back, pay you twice your original salary, and offer you a vice president position. Would you like my office?
No, I don't like your office.
That's SO YOU!
What's the catch?
The catch...
[sniffs]
...is that you need to shower, little man. You are RIPE! Whoo!
Quick! What time is it?
Somebody stole my watch!
Schmuck. I was a schmuck, and now I'm not a schmuck!
Grace, put yourself down for a towel, too.
What about my bonus?
Towel and a facecloth.
You've got a promo featuring America's favorite old fart reading a book in front of a fireplace! Now I have to kill all of you!
[Elliot points a shotgun right in Frank's face]
Hello, wabbit!
Could you give me a head start?
Sure. One thousand one, one thousand two, one thousand three!
[he fires]
Get me Standards and Practices in here. I want to see wreaths!
Claire, the whole world. Whole world, Claire.

[to the abstract/impressionist portrait on the wall]
Mother... help me.

[Screams and accidentally hits Grace]
Oh God! Oh God! Grace, go watch the show! He's here for me! Come on! Come on! Give it to me!
[falls to knees]
You think I'm afraid of you, the day I've had? I know what you came for. Come and get it, you pussy.
Brice!

[Getting the Fake Ghost away from Frank, who's obviously been scared by him]
Stop scaring Frank. Get this nutcake out.
It's a bone, you lucky dog!
you don't know who you are, you don't know what you want, and you don't know what the hell is going on!
I've made a few mistakes. I gotta live with that. But I do know who I am, I know what I want, and I know what's going on!

[the Ghost has disappeared into a monitor, and whistles to get his attention]
Hey, Frank! Up here!
What's going on?
How should I know? I'm just the ghost! So long, sucker!
We're gonna need champagne for 250 people, and send the stuff that you send to me. Don't send the stuff that I send to other people.
Would you *please*, for the love of *god*, and your own body!, stop the damn hammering?
I know the people.
Well, uh... granted but the people already wanna watch the show.

[a pause; shouting]
That isn't good enough! They have got to be so scared to miss it! So terrified!
[Quieter tone]
Now if I were in charge, and I am.
[laughs. IBC Executive laughs along with him but Frank looks at him and he shuts up]
Perhaps I can help you. Here's the kind of thing I would have done. Grace, cue it up.
[Frank stands in front of the screens. Thunder sounds and ominous music start playing]
Acid rain.
[Images and sounds of people screaming; Frank makes a screaming face]
Drug addictions.
[Shows a guy groaning and shooting up on heroin. Scene changes to a jet taking off]
International terrorism.
[Jet blows up in midair. Scene changes to a guy pulling a shotgun out of a car]
Freeway killers.
[Guy with shotgun fires]
Now more than ever...

[Speaking along with announcer]
It is important to remember the true meaning of Christmas.
Don't miss Charles Dickens' immortal classic Scrooge. Your life...

[Speaking along with announcer]
... might just depend on it.
[Promo holds on the image of a nuclear explosion. Frank takes a sip of coffee and looks at the executives]
Not bad, huh?

It's not too late on Christmas Eve to have fun, you can call an old college roommate, call, you know an old army buddy, call your personal banker. HEY! I don't hear any partying in that booth, Elliot!
Great!
[fires shotgun, silent pause down below on the set]
You heard him, party!
Now why wasn't I invited?
Now that was just an innocent window and you saw what I did to that! Ugh! You don't know who you're dealing with!
It's a night, you gotta party hardy Marty!
Seven o'clock. Psychos seize Santa's workshop and only Lee Majors can stop them.
[Frank is confronted by the ghost of his old boss]
No, you are a hallucination brought on by alcohol... Russian vodka poisoned by Chernobyl!
You know I like the rough stuff, don't you, Frank?
Oh, what is this, Frank? Oh, oh look, Frank! It's a toaster!
[hits him in the forehead with the toaster]
Go back to Jersey, you moron!
I'm gonna give you a little advice, Claire... Scrape 'em off. You wanna save somebody? Save yourself!
Oh, well, that's a really nice attitude on Christmas Eve!
Bah, humbug.
Niagara Falls, Frankie Angel.
Would you please hold the goddamn hammering, now!
[Frank notices a picture of Santa and Mrs. Claus on the wall]
Grace, what in the hell is this?
Oh, it's a painting, one of my kids did. See, there's Santa Claus and there's Mrs. Claus.
Honey, how many fingers does Mrs. Santa Claus have here?
Eleven.
Eleven. Right.
[rips it down]
It's crap. Lose it. I don't want it on the wall.
[tosses it in the wastebasket]
[Ghost of Christmas Past takes Frank to 1955]
Where are we?
Where are we? You mean, "When are we?"
I don't mind you shooting at me, Frank, but take it easy on the Bacardi!
You're staying here with me. We're working late.
But I have to take my son to the doctor.
GRACE! When I work late, YOU work late!
But I made the appointment two months ago!

[Inconsiderately]
I DON'T CARE!
[grabbing Grace]
We're indivisible. If I'm working late, you GOTTA work late! If you can't work late, I can't work late! If I can't work late, I CAN'T WORK LATE!
Why are you so angry?
Why haven't you learned how to button a coat?
Don't vex me Frank, or I'll fix your mouth so it won't hold soup.

[In the Ghost of Christmas Future funeral scene, we see Frank, hysterically terrified, banging inside around the coffin, trying to escape and make things right for himself before he is doomed for cremation. It is then that, in the next scene, the elevator doors open]

[Screaming; banging on the elevator doors as they open]
I wanna live!
[Frank is back at the IBC Television Network headquarters office floor, revealing that his doomed future has all been a hallucination]

[Sceams]
I'M ALIVE!
[Hallelujah Chorus plays]

[relieved]
Holy shit, what a break! I'm at work!
[Glances at the network's sun image as Eliot holds a shotgun at Frank]
Oh, God, it's the sun! I never thought I'd see the sun again. I'm alive!

[enraged]
Not for long!

[cheerful]
Milkman! Ha!
[Frank hugs and kisses Eliot]
I'm the Woodstock, baby! I'm gonna start with you.
[kisses Eliot again, this time on the lips]
You're one of my favorites. Come here! I'm alive and so are you!
[still excited and full of joy]
Hey! Are you glad to see me, or is this a shotgun in your pocket?
[Frank takes the shotgun, then drops it, causing it to fire a shot]
Okay, you've heard it. Come on!
[shoves Eliot to the elevators]
Great!

[frightened]
Don't hurt me!

[holds out his right hand for a low five]
Real alive! Pink slide!
[Eliot slaps on it... ]
Coming back!
[then Frank slaps Eliot's hand... ]
Long sole!
[while Eliot slaps Frank's shoe sole]
You know this one?
[lifts Eliot's shirt and blows a raspberry nuzzle into his bellybutton]
That's my thing. I'm gonna do this to everybody.
[blows a raspberry again; Eliot laughs]
All right, here's the deal.
[spins himself and Eliot around]
I'll hire you back, twice your original salary, and make you my Vice-President in charge of Programming, and I'll give an office up here. Would you like my office?
No, I don't like your office.
Ha, ha, ha!
[lets Eliot go]
That's so you!
What's the catch?
The catch, is that you gotta take a shower, little man. You are ripe! Whoa!

[confused]
There's a problem here. I was looking for a Francis Xavier Cross.
Schmuck. I was a schmuck, and now... I'm not a schmuck.
[grabs Eliot's neck with his arm]
Wait a minute. What time is it?
Somebody store my watch.
A quarter to! We didn't miss it! Ha, ha!
[playfully punches on Eliot's chest]
We didn't miss it!
Missed what?
Christmas! Merry Christmas!
[throws Eliot into the elevator]
Wah-hoo! Are you alone in there? We're gonna have some fun. You and I are gonna have some fun for once in this life, Loudermilk & Cross together.
[last lines after Frank Cross broke the fourth wall by encouraging the viewers to join the cast in singing "Put a Little Love in Your Heart"]

[to Wendie and his friends, excited]
My brother, the King of Christmas!
[Phone rings in the control room]

[picks up the receiver, but is snatched by Eliot]
Ouch!
Hello, um, Control Room. How can I help you?
This is Rhinelander. I wanna talk to the idiot who put that moron on the air
Oh, um, Brice Cummings is the idiot, sir. But he can't talk to you right now 'cause, uh, he's tied up.
[Brice is tied and restrained to a chair]
Uh-huh. Yes. In fact, he just said that you were an inflatulating butthead.

[shocked]
A butthead?
He said he never felt that way about a man before, but he really liked you in a certain way.
[Brice growls and mumbles to explain the truth, but to no avail; Preston, furious, then kicks one of his cats out of the way]
[Eliot burst inside the control room with his shotgun, knocking Brice unconcious]

[screams]
AAH!

[yells]
Shut up!
[holds the control room people hostage]
Don't touch that dial and stay at him!
